chapter.title: HTTP
chapter.para: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems. HTTP is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web, where hypertext documents include hyperlinks to other resources that the user can easily access, for example by a mouse click or by tapping the screen in a web browser.
ULFS currently supply HTTP-clients for software, HTTP-clients for users called web-browsers and HTTP-servers called web-servers.
It should mentioned that ULFS Packages system uses HTTP protocol to install source packages.

sect1.title: Text web-browser
sect1.para: Web-browsers which can run in text-mode (terminals, consoles) called text web-browsers.
ULFS user can use Links as text web-browser in case graphical system not installed or can't to be used.

To install Links web-browser you can run
chimp install links

To open website in text browser you can run
links http://umvirt.com

sect1.title: Graphical web-browser
sect1.para: Web-browsers which can run in graphical-mode called graphical web-browsers.
ULFS user can use NetSurf as graphical web-browser in case graphical system is installed.

To install NetSurf web-browser you can run
chimp install netsurf

To open website in text browser you can run
nsgtk http://umvirt.com

sect1.title: Apache web-server
sect1.para: Apache HTTPd is most popular Web-server which can be used to hosting static and dynamic web-sites.
Apache HTTPd can be used to host ULFS Packages service in your local area network in case no Internet connection available.

To install Apache HTTPd web-browser you can run
chimp install httpd

To place openssh-server on autoload you have to run command:
cd /usr/share/blfs-systemd-units sudo make install-httpd
